intro: Pterospermopsis nossibeensis, commonly known as the Gabon tamarind, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Caesalpiniaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain flat, edible seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a food source. Its ecological importance lies in providing habitat and food for various wildlife species in its native environment.
